label: Sandy Island Plantation Journal, Volume 1, 1792
description: This is a Sandy Island plantation journal written inside of The South Carolina and Georgia Almanac for the year 1792.  The plantation journal documents the planting of crops (rice, corns, and potatoes), the maintenance of ditches and drains, slave records, complications with the hiring of an overseer, livestock, and business relations with Laurel Hill Plantation.

metadata.label: Description

metadata.label: Digitization Specifications
metadata.value: 600 dpi, 48-bit depth, color, Sinarback eVolution 86, Sinar. Archival masters are tiffs.
